result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

10:28 AM Defendant COLTON R OLSON in court.  Attorney David W. Field in court for COLTON R OLSON.  Prosecuting attorney Sara Matthews in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Information to be filed. 
Defendant Advised of Constitutional Rights. 
Defendant informed of charges and penalties. 
22CF176, Defendant pleads no contest to Count 1; however, court acquiesces to DAGP and plea is not accepted at this time. 
22CF176, Count 3, Defendant enters no contest plea. 
22CF145, Count 1, Defendant enters no contest plea.  
Factual basis and probable cause found. 
Court accepts pleas as voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently made and finds defendant guilty. 

Remaining charges in 22CF176 and 22CF145 DRI. 22CF147 & 22CM41 DRI. 

Court orders: 

22CF176, Count 3 and 22CF145, Count 1 
Withheld sentence, 2 years probation

records.addlTxt:
1:31 PM Prosecuting attorney Lawrence Jean Broeren in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant COLTON R OLSON in court.  Attorney David W. Field in court for COLTON R OLSON. 
Attorney waives reading of complaint. 
Defendant is informed of charges. 
Defendant received copy of Criminal Complaint.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 5, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Review hearing scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 09:30 am.

01:46 PM Defendant COLTON R OLSON in court with Attorney Lester H Liptak.  Scott Zehr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
22CM41, 22CF147, 22CF145, 22CF176. To retain Attorney Wilhelm.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant is ordered to report to pretrial monitoring immediately after court and must comply with pretrial
monitoring conditions.
Defendant shall not possess any drug paraphernalia.
Defendant shall not possess any syringes unless medically required.
Not to possess or consume any illegal drugs.
Not to possess or consume any prescription drugs not prescribed.
Not to associate with anyone involved in illegal drug activities.
Not to possess or consume any alcohol.
Not to go on any premises where primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.
Not to drive without a valid driver's license.

Defendant COLTON R OLSON in court with Attorney Kirby Daniel Harless.  Defendant COLTON R OLSON in custody.  Lawrence Jean Broeren appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  COLTON R OLSON appeared by video means with Attorney.
